result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie K Harshman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Count 2 in 21CF320 and 21CF182.
Consecutive to: Count 1 in 21CF320.

miscConds.notes: Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees. Cash bond posted was returned to the poster when a signature bond was ordered and therefore, no bond money will be applied to financial obligations owed.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, including methamphetamine.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 119 days credit if revoked from probation.

records.addlTxt: Transcript - Sentencing Hearing, October 6th, 2022.

3:20 PM Defendant Stephanie K Harshman in court, in custody.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Stephanie K Harshman.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
This covers 22CF55, 21CF320, 21CF182, 22CF31. 

22CF55 - Defense believes the case will be dismissed and read-in. State relates and agrees. Court orders 22CF55 dismissed and read-in. 

No additions/corrections to jail. State relates regarding the PSI. Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court. 

Court relates and orders: 

21CF182 - Sentence withheld - 3 years probation consecutive to Count 1 in 21CF320 and Concurrent with Count 2 in 21CF320. 
2 days credit if revoked. 
Court costs - Cash bonds to be applied. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, including methamphetamine. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 

21CF320 - 
Count 1: 
1 year 6 months initial confinement. Court grants 32 days if revoked. 
Taycheedah Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. 
2 years extended supervision. 
Court costs - Cash bonds to be applied. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, including methamphetamine. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 

Count 2: Sentence withheld - 3 years probation consecutive to Count 1. 
Court costs - Cash bonds to be applied. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, including methamphetamine. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 


22CF31 - Sentence withheld - 3 years probation consecutive to Count 1 in 21CF320 and Concurrent with Count 2 in 21CF320, and 21CF182. 
119 days credit if revoked. 
Court costs - Cash bonds to be applied. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, including methamphetamine. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 

CC: BC Jail . Felony admonitions given, including firearms and voters rights. The following form was provided to the Defendant for signature: Notice and acknowledge of defendant's voting ineligibility. Appellate Rights,  A copy of the written explanation of determinate sentence was provided to the Defendant.
